intro: Erysimum baumgartenianum, commonly known as the yellow wallflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of the Middle East. It is a herbaceous perennial that produces bright yellow flowers in early spring. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has finely divided, fern-like leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its botanical features include showy, four-petaled flowers and a taproot system that helps it survive in rocky or arid conditions.
